page.title: 10Famous People In Steyning
page.content: { W.B.Yeats}was a famous poet.He wrote a lot of poems.He was born in 1865 and died in 1936.{Yeats}thought Steyning was lovely so he wrote to his wife describing it.His full name was William Butler Yeats.Yeats wrote some of his later poems in Steyning. { { William Penn} {William Penn}didnot come from a working class back ground although he was a Quaker.He was the son of an Admiral.{William} went to Cambridge University.When he was 25 he became a threat to Steyning and Sussex when he started to hold Quaker meetings.Later {William}moved to America,he came back in 1701.When he stayed at Wiston House near Steyning. {The Byshopp Family {Henry}was the younger son of Sir Thomas who owned Parham.Thomas was the M.P. for Steyning in 1586.
